content:
SizeF Struct

Definition

Stores an ordered pair of floating-point numbers, typically the width and height of a rectangle.

In this Article

[System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter(typeof(System.Drawing.SizeFConverter))]
[System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComVisible(true)]
public struct SizeF
Inheritance
Object
System.ValueType
SizeF

Remarks

The unit for a SizeF structure depends on the PageUnit and PageScale settings for the Graphics object that is used to draw.

Constructors

SizeF(PointF)

Initializes a new instance of the SizeF structure from the specified PointF structure.

public SizeF (System.Drawing.PointF pt);
pt
PointF

The PointF structure from which to initialize this SizeF structure.

SizeF(SizeF)

Initializes a new instance of the SizeF structure from the specified existing SizeF structure.

public SizeF (System.Drawing.SizeF size);
size
SizeF

The SizeF structure from which to create the new SizeF structure.

SizeF(Single,Single)

Initializes a new instance of the SizeF structure from the specified dimensions.

public SizeF (float width, float height);
width
Single

The width component of the new SizeF structure.

height
Single

The height component of the new SizeF structure.

Fields

Empty

Gets a SizeF structure that has a stem.Drawing.SizeF.Height* and stem.Drawing.SizeF.Width* value of 0.

public static readonly System.Drawing.SizeF Empty;

Properties

Height

Gets or sets the vertical component of this SizeF structure.

public float Height { get; set; }
Value
Single

The vertical component of this SizeF structure, typically measured in pixels.

Remarks

The unit for the Height and Width of the SizeF structure depend on the PageUnit and PageScale settings for the Graphics object used to draw.

IsEmpty

Gets a value that indicates whether this SizeF structure has zero width and height.

public bool IsEmpty { get; }
Value
Boolean

This property returns true when this SizeF structure has both a width and height of zero; otherwise, false.

Width

Gets or sets the horizontal component of this SizeF structure.

public float Width { get; set; }
Value
Single

The horizontal component of this SizeF structure, typically measured in pixels.

Remarks

The unit for the Height and Width of the SizeF structure depend on the PageUnit and PageScale settings for the Graphics object that is used to draw.

Methods

Add(SizeF,SizeF)

Adds the width and height of one SizeF structure to the width and height of another SizeF structure.

public static System.Drawing.SizeF Add (System.Drawing.SizeF sz1, System.Drawing.SizeF sz2);
sz1
SizeF

The first SizeF structure to add.

sz2
SizeF

The second SizeF structure to add.

Returns
SizeF

A SizeF structure that is the result of the addition operation.

Equals(Object)

Tests to see whether the specified object is a SizeF structure with the same dimensions as this SizeF structure.

public override bool Equals (object obj);
obj
Object

The Object to test.

Returns
Boolean

This method returns true if obj is a SizeF and has the same width and height as this SizeF; otherwise, false.

GetHashCode()

Returns a hash code for this Size structure.

public override int GetHashCode ();
Returns
Int32

An integer value that specifies a hash value for this Size structure.

Subtract(SizeF,SizeF)

Subtracts the width and height of one SizeF structure from the width and height of another SizeF structure.

public static System.Drawing.SizeF Subtract (System.Drawing.SizeF sz1, System.Drawing.SizeF sz2);
sz1
SizeF

The SizeF structure on the left side of the subtraction operator.

sz2
SizeF

The SizeF structure on the right side of the subtraction operator.

Returns
SizeF

A SizeF structure that is a result of the subtraction operation.

ToPointF()

Converts a SizeF structure to a PointF structure.

public System.Drawing.PointF ToPointF ();
Returns
PointF

Returns a PointF structure.

ToSize()

Converts a SizeF structure to a Size structure.

public System.Drawing.Size ToSize ();
Returns
Size

Returns a Size structure.

Remarks

The SizeF structure is converted to a Size structure by truncating the values of the SizeF to the next lower integer values.

ToString()

Creates a human-readable string that represents this SizeF structure.

public override string ToString ();
Returns
String

A string that represents this SizeF structure.

Operators

op_Addition(SizeF,SizeF)

Adds the width and height of one SizeF structure to the width and height of another SizeF structure.

public static System.Drawing.SizeF op_Addition (System.Drawing.SizeF sz1, System.Drawing.SizeF sz2);
sz1
SizeF

The first SizeF structure to add.

sz2
SizeF

The second SizeF structure to add.

Returns
SizeF

A Size structure that is the result of the addition operation.

op_Equality(SizeF,SizeF)

Tests whether two SizeF structures are equal.

public static bool op_Equality (System.Drawing.SizeF sz1, System.Drawing.SizeF sz2);
sz1
SizeF

The SizeF structure on the left side of the equality operator.

sz2
SizeF

The SizeF structure on the right of the equality operator.

Returns
Boolean

This operator returns true if sz1 and sz2 have equal width and height; otherwise, false.

op_Explicit(SizeF) 

public static System.Drawing.PointF op_Explicit (System.Drawing.SizeF size);
size
SizeF

To be added.

Returns
PointF

To be added.

op_Inequality(SizeF,SizeF)

Tests whether two SizeF structures are different.

public static bool op_Inequality (System.Drawing.SizeF sz1, System.Drawing.SizeF sz2);
sz1
SizeF

The SizeF structure on the left of the inequality operator.

sz2
SizeF

The SizeF structure on the right of the inequality operator.

Returns
Boolean

This operator returns true if sz1 and sz2 differ either in width or height; false if sz1 and sz2 are equal.

op_Subtraction(SizeF,SizeF)

Subtracts the width and height of one SizeF structure from the width and height of another SizeF structure.

public static System.Drawing.SizeF op_Subtraction (System.Drawing.SizeF sz1, System.Drawing.SizeF sz2);
sz1
SizeF

The SizeF structure on the left side of the subtraction operator.

sz2
SizeF

The SizeF structure on the right side of the subtraction operator.

Returns
SizeF

A SizeF that is the result of the subtraction operation.
